result.title: A Few Questions About ACM-ICPC Rules
result.content:
Hi,

2 days ago I send an e-mail to ACM-ICPC people(I don't know which word is suitable here maybe authoritative or director) but they didn't reply my e-mail yet. So I wanted to know can anyone answer those questions. It's the last registration date of SEERC so I'm in a little bit rush. Thank you to all of you. I'm pasting my e-mail here.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Hi,

I’m not sure about who do I have to communicate with, so I’m sending it to several e-mails, I’m sorry about it.

We were contestant for World Finals 2017 from TOBB University of Echonomics and Technology but 2 of my teammates couldn’t get visas so I participated alone in finals. In awarding ceremony Dr. Bill Poucher said they will give our team a free pass for WF2018 because we couldn’t participate as a whole team. So in this case I have a few questions and they’re very important for us and we’ll very glad if you can answer them.

If a whole team couldn’t get a visa, their “maximum number of attend to WF” increased to 3 because this year they didn’t participate. But in our team I participated my teammates didn’t. So do we have one more attend or two left?

If we change one participant from our team, can we still participate at WF without regionals?

Also I have a friend whose name is Murat Ekici. He started university this year and he went to Bogazici University in Turkey. We had really wanting to participate together at WF for like a 3 year. But we ended up in different universities and we wanted to make sure there isn’t any possible way. However when we were checking rules of ACM-ICPC we found that a person could attend to ACM-ICPC from different university if he/she is a intern at that university. So Murat involved in a Algorithmic Game Theory Lab in my university. So we wanted to make sure that it doesn’t coincide with rules of ACM-ICPC. Can we participate with him at regionals as team of TOBB University of Echonomics and Technology?

We are waiting for your reply and we will be grateful for it. Sorry for disturbing you with such a long e-mail.

Thanks, Mustafa Erdem Kirez
